body:
A full example using INSERT INTO courtesy of Python Central:

# Import the SQLite3 module
import sqlite3
db = sqlite3.connect(':memory:')
c = db.cursor()
c.execute('''CREATE TABLE users(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, phone TEXT)''')
users = [
    ('John', '5557241'), 
    ('Adam', '5547874'), 
    ('Jack', '5484522'), 
    ('Monthy',' 6656565')
]

c.executemany('''INSERT INTO users(name, phone) VALUES(?,?)''', users)
db.commit()

# Print the users
c.execute('''SELECT * FROM users''')
for row in c:
    print(row)

db.close()

See also Is it possible to insert multiple rows at a time in an SQLite database?
title: Adding a list of values to a column in sqlite table
